datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: authgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: authgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: authgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: authgrp

expire-days.name: expire-days
expire-days.help: Time in days before the user's password expires.

warn-days.name: warn-days
warn-days.help: Time in days before a password expiration warning message is displayed to the user upon login.

expired-password-renewal.name: expired-password-renewal
expired-password-renewal.help: Enable/disable renewal of a password that already is expired.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable renewal of a password that already is expired.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable renewal of a password that already is expired

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable renewal of a password that already is expired.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable renewal of a password that already is expired

min-lower-case-letter.name: min-lower-case-letter
min-lower-case-letter.help: Minimum number of lowercase characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).

min-upper-case-letter.name: min-upper-case-letter
min-upper-case-letter.help: Minimum number of uppercase characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).

min-non-alphanumeric.name: min-non-alphanumeric
min-non-alphanumeric.help: Minimum number of non-alphanumeric characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).

min-number.name: min-number
min-number.help: Minimum number of numeric characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).

min-change-characters.name: min-change-characters
min-change-characters.help: Minimum number of unique characters in new password which do not exist in old password (0 - 128, default = 0. This attribute overrides reuse-password if both are enabled).

reuse-password.name: reuse-password
reuse-password.help: Enable/disable reuse of password. If both reuse-password and min-change-characters are enabled, min-change-characters overrides.

options.name: enable
options.help: Users are allowed to reuse the same password up to a limit.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Users are allowed to reuse the same password up to a limit

options.name: disable
options.help: Users must create a new password.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Users must create a new password

reuse-password-limit.name: reuse-password-limit
reuse-password-limit.help: Number of times passwords can be reused (0 - 20, default = 0. If set to 0, can reuse password an unlimited number of times.).
